intro: Zaluzania augusta, commonly known as the Texas thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as prairies and woodland edges. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of both ray and disc florets. Zaluzania augusta is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in partial to full sunlight.
